website_summaries.verdict: A Ferrari among gaming GPUs, Nvidia's GeForce RTX 2080 Ti Founders Edition represents the fastest class of cards that money can buy. Just be ready to pay a supercar price to enjoy its luxury ride for 4K and high-refresh gaming.
pros: Sets a new bar for single-GPU performance
Supports ray tracing and DLSS for future games
Easy to attain at least modest overclocks
cons: Founders Edition commands a $200 premium over an already expensive base/reference card
Games will take time to adopt ray tracing and DLSS

customer_reviews.title: premature death
customer_reviews.text: It actually pretty good for a month it worked, then all of sudden it died and no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Artefacts after one day
customer_reviews.text: After playing some games on first day I saw some artefacts appearing, even on Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Thoumelin

customer_reviews.title: BEAST of GPU
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for my video editing PC and I am very proud of the purchase. It is expensive, yes. But if you want to invest for the long term this is great option. 2080TI GPU should be able to run the majority of video games at 60fps in 4K with all the graphics settings cranked to the max, which is a feat previous graphics card have struggled to match. The rendering in premiere pro with Enabled GPU Acceleration (CUDA) is so much fast than a normal rendering.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast of a GPU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this GPU over a year ago and it's been in daily use ever since. I may have got lucky reading other reviews as it's never missed a beat in my system (touch wood!). Paired with an i9-9900k, I can set games to max level at 3440x1440 no matter what the game is, and the highest temperature I've seen on the GPU is 65oc. It's not the cheapest 2080ti by any means and is still the same price, or thereabouts, I paid over 12 months ago, but it smashes any game you throw at it, runs cool and whisper quiet. Fully recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sn00ts

customer_reviews.title: very good card
customer_reviews.text: bought this expecting it not too work well, it performs well , it might depend on your rig, if youve spent a lot on all the other hardware it seems to work well, temperatures im getting it between 34 and 40 degrees, thats okay doesnt get higher than 40 maximum 45 , , if you buy it you wont regret it
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Great card for overclocking enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent GPU, 11 gigabytes of VRAM is more than enough for playing any current games, but wait until the 3000 series cards are announced. It'll drop in price by a few hundred pounds. The card itself is very long, a 2.7 form factor which means it'll cover SATA ports on some motherboards including the MSI B450 Tomahawk Max which is what I'm currently using.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot C

customer_reviews.title: Showed a black screen- tested on multiple systems, and looked used.
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get the card, upgrading from my GTX970, so a big upgrade. However, all I could get was a black screen. Furthermore, the card i got looked like it had been used before. Tested on multiple systems with multiple display port cables. The card powers on but no output, broken. These con artists are now refusing to refund me after sending me a broke/used item.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T

customer_reviews.title: A beast of a VGA!
customer_reviews.text: U can push this up to an amazing stable 2100mhz keeping as good temperature as 75 degrees and even playing at 99% of use during long gaming sessions still silent enough. The best 2080ti u will ever find. Perfect conditions of use with an i9 9900k ultra settings: 4K 60fps / 1440p 144fps / 1080p 240fps
customer_reviews.author: Igor Monasterio

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money but who cares, it’s nice to max out games and not worry
customer_reviews.text: Card is an absolute beast, if using on a 1080p monitor you can get upto the 240 fps the monitors support and at 4K max out most games at a steady 60fps. So far haven’t had a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: james greenberry

customer_reviews.title: GeForce
customer_reviews.text: This is a monster friend has the version below this and said that it’s best he’s brought so far, brought the latest one but seems not to be working as it should end up sending it back and getting something just as good from PC world and slightly cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jawo

customer_reviews.title: best geforce RXT 2080TI  Rog Strix OC 11264MB GddR6
customer_reviews.text: the best graphics card best buy in money gives top performance. all round its best .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Santa Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power but defected
customer_reviews.text: While the card is a beast, I wasn't lucky and I had to send it back due a problem with the fans. Great customer service from the 3rd party seller
customer_reviews.author: Carnage86

customer_reviews.title: No Bundle code
customer_reviews.text: When i was ordering it it said that i was eligible for the Wolfenstein Youngblood bundle but i dont have a code???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. NEW GRAPHICS CARDS COMING
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. NEW GRAPHICS CARDS COMING OUT SOON AT MORE THAN HALF THE PRICE WITH BETTER PERFORMANCE. STAY CLEAR
customer_reviews.author: Connor Coverley

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but absurdly powerful gpu
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, super quiet, premium feel and look. I previously had a strict 1070 and was very happy with that. This card is a beast. Obviously the price is absurd, but if it lasts a good few years it will be worth it in the end because it currently pumps out high frame rates at 1440p in all AAA games save for those bad Ubisoft ones.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. I own a 2070 which is good so this must be amazing. Butb1200 for this when rtx 3060 is around the corner for 499 with literally equal performance..? Lols
customer_reviews.author: Prabin Chhetri

customer_reviews.title: No nvidia games offers
customer_reviews.text: The card is very good however Why no nvidia game offers like most of the other websites Amazon need to address
customer_reviews.author: Wael E

customer_reviews.title: Better cards on the way
customer_reviews.text: It's ridiculous still charging so high prices with the newer cards at almost half the price and twice the performance! Do not buy at such a high price. In any case your make of the newer 3080 cards why have you cheaped out on the capacitors compared to the Nvidia Founders Edition AND then charging it again at a higher price! GPU market can be absolute trash. The new card needs to be max £650
customer_reviews.author: Mx

customer_reviews.title: superb GPU
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic GPU, handles superbly anything I have on a super widescreen monitor 5120 x 1440 with games set to maximum settings. Something noticeable is that it runs super cool compared to other 2080ti models out there, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2080 Ti OC Edition 11 GB Graphic Card GDDR6 with Enthusiast-Level Technology for Extreme 4K and VR Gaming ROG-STRIX-RTX2080TI-O11G
product_meta.description:
Size Name:OC Mode - GPU Boost Clock: 1665 MHz| Style Name:ROG Strix Gaming OC EditionOUTSHINE THE COMPETITIONThe ROG Strix GeForce RTX™ 2080Ti teams up NVIDIA®' s A-list GPU with an elite cast of specialists, setting the stage for epic gaming action. Gargantuan power delivery provides the muscle to push overclocking boundaries, while cooling that' s honed to perfection keeps the spotlight squarely on Turing™' s performance. And with an arsenal of utilities that allow you to customize and tweak this extreme hardware, you call the shots.COOLINGAxial-tech FansBetter, Faster, StrongerTo keep Turing™' s temperatures under tight control, we' ve brought a larger cooler to the table, which necessitates a more powerful and efficient fan that must maintain a whisper-quiet acoustic profile. Axial-tech meets these three design challenges by implementing our latest innovations for fan performance. We' ve reduced the size of the fan' s hub to allow for longer blades and added a barrier ring that increases structural integrity and downward air pressure through the ROG Strix GeForce RTX™ 2080Ti' s heatsink array. And we' ve also implemented IP5X dust resistance to seal the fan' s internals from particle ingress to keeps things running smoothly. The new design allows Axial-tech fans to shift more air and spin at higher speeds without increasing noise levels.0dB TechnologyQuiet intelligence0dB technology allows fans to stop spinning when the GPU core temperature remains below 55 Celsius, letting you enjoy light gaming in complete silence. If temps rise, the fans automatically start up again. *To activate 0dB mode, please engage Quiet (Q) bios mode by using the onboard switch.2.7-Slot DesignSink your heat into thisThis generation, our top-end cards adopt a 2.7-slot footprint to accommodate a larger heatsink because bigger is better. We' ve increased the overall surface area...
